ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Chains Reliability
ygData.msgSnippet: I have to agree with Harmonic here.  I play a ranger as much as I play my bard (both are level 35ish) (bard lost 35 in a fun lil naggy run) As a groups snare
ygData.messageBody:
I have to agree with Harmonic here. I play a ranger as much as I play my
bard (both are level 35ish) (bard lost 35 in a fun lil naggy run) As a
groups snare person it's _critical_ that you keep npc's from running. It's
not just an option. It's mandatory.

If I'm in a group and I'm not pulling my weight snaring then something is
seriously wrong. If the person doing the snaring isn't pulling their weight
then they get disbanded. I hold myself to this standard as well. If one
runs because someone rooted/Ebonied/whatevered then it's not as much of a
'blame' but there's still some blame there.

The only time I will tell a group "it's not my fault if it runs" is if there
is a magician with an earth pet. as I said before 90% of the groups I'm in
I won't allow the magician to use that pet. They get _four_. There's no
reason for them to use one that roots as it's power.

At any rate. Harmonic is correct. If someone's job in the group is to keep
things snared then they darn well better do it.

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Ryan Honeyman" <honeyman@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, March 20, 2000 4:49 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Chains Reliability


> From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
>
>
> > You would bet wrong. I've had snares wear off on me.
>
>
> I'll be blunt. Snares duration is all or nothing. Snare doesn't
> wear off. I see you fall into the lazy druid category now.
>
> Snare when the mob is at 1/3 of it's life, you'll have best results.
> If you are the primary healer, your snare job doesn't change.
> You heal, and then you snare. There are places where snaring is
> critical, Permafrost and SolA come to mind. If you got resisted
> on Snare, then chances are the monster will not be running from
> you as it's 6ish levels higher than you are. Fight non-red mobs,
> or find a party who is closer to your level. Snare works perfectly
> then. I think it's not so much that the spell is busted, but rather
> the player. Gotta hate user error.
>
> Harmonic.
>
>
>
